title: Competition (Top 40 under 40)
description: How do we get bright entrepreneurs to submit innovative proposals to the Catalyst program.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal does nor define how it will attract new proposers on catalyst. It talks about creating another competition which awards entrepreneurs for their ideas. It seems the proposal is re creating catalyst in a smaller scale. I personally do not actually see value in this idea beyond what Catalyst is already offering (grant money for proposals which win the 'competition'). The proposer also lacks to define the success of the project and how the project will be advertised, who would judge the participants and the breakdown of the funds requested.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is an entrepreneur who took part in a similar competition as the one proposed. This does not really show the capabilities of the proposer to actuate such a competition. Furthermore, the plan itself is very brief and lacks detail. It does not give confidence to its success.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal lacks identification of specific goals and therefore un-auditable. In the ambit of the challenge goals in general, it also fails to deliver or offer added value.

f6_assessments.q0:
Hi - the underlying ide is good but you dont adress the challenge: how to bring entrepeneurs from OUTSIDE the cardano community to submit proposals.
You should be more precise on:
Where to find the entrepeneurs, how to target them. Your solution only adresses the problem in finding good ideas - but we need to broaden the reach of cardano..
f6_assessments.q1: As states above you are not adressing the goal of this challenge. Hence successful implementationnis unlikely.
f6_assessments.q2: Although i loke the idea on finding good prposals out of a given pool - finding the pool itsself is the real challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great but there is no substantial information on how it is to be carried out. it gives no real information.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer knows about the idea but seems to not know how to plan r organize such a project.
f6_assessments.q2: There is not enough information given on how funds are going to be used and no timeline for progress of project.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal could have been clearer about how the competition would atract more entrepreneurs to impact Cardano Ecosystem. Thinking about Project Catalyst, the path is the same of the competition: the best proposals are sponsored by the Project to enable the proposer to make the idea real. In short, the entrepreneur that has the best idea earns funds in Cardano. If this logic doesn't atract the entrepreneur, why would a competition with the same train of thought do?
f6_assessments.q1: The budget could have been better explained and broken down into identifiable items. The roadmap also could have been better explained. It's missing a plan or a scheme to cite the resources that would be necessary: how many people, how much time to plan and create the idea competition and to design it in reality, etc.
f6_assessments.q2: There aren't enough details in the proposal to afirm that there is a clear way to audit it. Some important information are missing like: a time horizon to the competition, roadmap, milestones, metrics and KPI's. Therefore, it's impossible to know how audit this proposal success.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement doesn't present a problem. There is a rationale related to the challenge, but the proposal is only a draft. There is not enough information for impact assessment. I would recommend using the Catalyst documentation as a reference for a new proposal, more precisely the document proposal writing guide in the FAQ section on the IdeaScale Catalyst homepage.
